business.headline: India-Israel free trade talks kick off in Delhi ahead of PM Modi's visit to IsraelAhead of PM Modi's visit to Israel on Wednesday, India and Israel began the first round of negotiations for a proposed Free Trade Agreement in New Delhi.

Venezuela sends mega 2-million-barrel oil cargoes to India as exports surgeVenezuela has chartered its first supertankers since easing US sanctions, boosting crude exports to India as refiners seek discounted heavy oil and diversify away from Russian supplies.

Tata Sons defers N Chandrasekaran's 3rd term decision after Noel Tata's conditionsN Chandrasekaran's term ends in February 2027, and the board of Tata Sons was discussing extending the same when a set of conditions was put forth by Noel Tata.

Kalyani Group firms settle Sebi case for Rs 4.12 crore after NSE reportKalyani Group's two listed companies have settled Sebi proceedings over alleged fund diversion, paying over Rs 4.12 crore without admitting guilt. The regulator's probe revealed suspicious investments and multi-layered transactions involving related parties.

Want to save tax legally? Here are 5 ways to earn income tax-freeYou don't always need complicated tricks to save on taxes. Certain incomes and investments in India are fully exempt, letting you save while staying within the law.

Silver falls over Rs 5000, gold drops Rs 1,000: Is this a buying opportunity?Bullion prices came under pressure, with silver and gold both slipping on Tuesday. After the recent correction, investors are now watching closely to see if lower prices present a buying opportunity.

IDFC First Bank transfers Rs 583 crore to Haryana following fraud incidentAccording to a stock market filing, IDFC bank has paid out 100% of the principal and interest to the relevant departments of Haryana Government as claimed, which works out to a net amount of INR 583 crore.

Taken a home loan? Here's what happens if you miss 3 EMIsA home loan EMI is a long-term responsibility that borrowers usually plan for carefully. But income disruptions or unexpected expenses can affect repayments. If EMIs are missed repeatedly, how do lenders react, and how serious can it become? Let's have a look.
Sensex ends 1,068 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 6%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 1,068.74 points to close at 82,225.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 288.35 points to end at 25,424.65.

Why are India's ultra-rich preferring Gurugram over Mumbai for their homesMumbai recorded ultra-luxury home sales worth Rs 24,120 crore during the calendar year. This is the highest ever value achieved by any Indian city in this segment.

Paying rent to parents or spouse to save tax? New rules tighten HRA claimsClaiming HRA by paying rent to family members has been a common tax-saving method. Yet, changes expected from April 2026 could make these claims more closely examined than before.

Is redevelopment a safe bet for real estate investors?Redevelopment today is not just about replacing old buildings. It is about creating larger, more valuable assets that align with how people live and work now, closer to transport, offices, and social infrastructure.

IDFC First Bank's Rs 590-crore fraud: What went wrong and how bad is the damage?A fraud this size should never have slipped past routine controls. This article attempts to explain just how sharply the Rs 590-crore fraud impacts IDFC First Bank.

Using Groww, Zerodha or other trading platforms? Here's why DP charges matterMany investors focus on brokerage fees but often miss another cost, i.e., DP charges. Whether you trade on Groww, Zerodha, or similar platforms, knowing these fees can help you avoid surprises.

Infosys, HCLTech, Tech Mahindra sink up to 7%: Why are IT stocks falling today?A sharp slide in India's biggest tech stocks has once again put the spotlight on global uncertainty and the growing fear that artificial intelligence is reshaping the industry faster than expected.

Sensex plunges 1,000 points: Why is the stock market falling today?By the closing bell, the BSE Sensex had dropped 1,068.74 points to 82,225.92, while the NSE Nifty50 settled at 25,424.65, down 288.35 points.

Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade as IT stocks bleed; Infosys down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 722.19 points to 82,572.47, while the NSE Nifty50 plummeted 203.60 points to 25,509.40 as of 10:04 am.

FedEx seeks refund, sues US over Trump's emergency tariff order: ReportFedEx said that it has filed a lawsuit in the US Court of International Trade seeking a refund of tariffs imposed under Trump's emergency powers. The case follows a recent ruling by the US Supreme Court, which found that the tariffs were unlawful.

Paramount raises offer for Warner Bros Discovery amid Netflix threat: ReportThe fresh bid marks another twist in what has become one of the biggest deal battles in the global media industry. Warner Bros Discovery owns some of Hollywood's most recognised titles, including the Harry Potter and Game of Thrones franchises.

Banks can't afford to mis-sell, it is an offence: Nirmala SitharamanFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said banks cannot treat mis-selling as routine business and called it an offence. Her remarks come as the Reserve Bank of India is preparing to issue guidance aimed at curbing mis-selling practices by banks.

entertainment.headline: Deepika Padukone embraces 40 with Ross Geller energy, fans react Deepika Padukone, turning 40, embraced the milestone with a witty 'Friends' meme, drawing smiles from fans online.

Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda and the love story fans noticed long before Known to fans as ViRosh, Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's love story is believed to have grown quietly over years of friendship and shared moments, away from the spotlight. From co-stars to life partners, their easy and unhurried bond is what has made audiences across India root for them.

Only Murders star Martin Short's daughter Katherine dies by suicide: Report Katherine Short, the eldest child of Martin Short, has died at the age of 42. The Los Angeles Police Department responded to a call on Monday evening, where she was found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

Pride and Prejudice teaser unveils Emma Corrin, Jack Lowden as Lizzy and Darcy Netflix unveiled the first teaser for Dolly Alderton's Pride and Prejudice, introducing Emma Corrin and Jack Lowden in a faithful new adaptation set for 2026.

Vijay's mother gifts Rashmika heirloom bangles at sangeet ceremony Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's wedding festivities have started in Udaipur with a sangeet ceremony. Highlight of the evening: Vijay's mother gifting heirloom bangles to Rashmika as a symbol of love and acceptance.

Government blocks 5 streaming platforms over obscene content. Check list The I&B Ministry has blocked five OTT platforms for streaming obscene content. Read on to find out which platforms have been hauled up for violation of existing content regulations.

News regarding removal of The Kerala Story 2 teaser false, misleading: Producers The makers of The Kerala Story 2 – Goes Beyond have issued a statement refuting claims that the film's teaser has been removed following court intervention.

Siddharth Roy Kapur on Bollywood box office trends: Signs of winner-takes-all Siddharth Roy Kapur expressed concern over Bollywood's "winner-takes-all" trend, noting that top hits now dominate total collections. He highlighted how this shift has made women-led projects increasingly difficult.

Ram Gopal Varma calls Dhurandhar 2 an asteroid strike on masala filmmaking Ram Gopal Varma has made bold predictions about Dhurandhar: The Revenge, calling it an "asteroid strike" that could change mainstream filmmaking in India.
Amul celebrates Boong's historic BAFTA feat with creative new topical The historic win of Lakshmipriya Devi's Manipuri film Boong at BAFTA was celebrated by Amul with a creative special topical ad.

Parineeti Chopra turns her love story with Raghav Chadha into a book for son Neer Parineeti Chopra shared that she has created a personalised storybook for her son Neer that beautifully narrates her love story with husband Raghav Chadha. The actor called it a magical and lifelong memory for her child.

Vikrant Massey, Manushi Chhillar's Nainital shoot BTS leaves fans curious. Pics Excitement builds as early glimpses of Vikrant Massey and Manushi Chhillar filming together in Nainital have led to widespread speculation among fans about their upcoming collaboration, even as official details remain under wraps.

Kajol celebrates 27 years with Ajay Devgn, says they deserve a medal and trophy Kajol celebrated 27 years of marriage to Ajay Devgn on February 24, by sharing an unseen photo and a witty note on social media.

Splitsvilla 7 fame and seven-time Mr India winner Mayank Pawar dies at 37 Fitness enthusiast and Mr India titleholder Mayank Pawar, known for his appearance on Splitsvilla 7, has died at the age of 37. His death was announced on Instagram, leaving fans and fellow contestants in shock.

Huma Qureshi reacts to Dhurandhar 2-Toxic clash, says it's a win-win situation Huma Qureshi has reacted to the box office clash between Dhurandhar: The Revenge and Toxic. The actor believes the Eid release will be a fantastic time for moviegoers.

Allu Sirish clears air on Ram Charan attending cocktail party in Ayyappa deeksha Allu Sirish has responded to the online debate over Ram Charan's brief appearance at his pre-wedding cocktail party. He clarified that Charan arrived before any alcohol was served while observing Ayyappa deeksha.

I keep asking if he's really gone: Hema Malini reacts to BAFTA's Dharmendra tribute Hema Malini called Dharmendra's BAFTA recognition "heartening" in an interview. The 79th BAFTA ceremony highlighted India's achievements, with Boong winning Best Children's and Family Film.
Janhvi Kapoor praises Anil Kapoor's Subedaar trailer: Chachu is back Janhvi Kapoor cheered for uncle Anil Kapoor as the trailer of Subedaar was released, praising his powerful performance.

Rashmika-Vijay wedding: Tharun Bhascker, Eesha Rebba and celebs arrive in Udaipur Director Tharun Bhascker, actor Eesha Rebba and stylist Shravya Varma were among the first guests to arrive in Udaipur ahead of actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's wedding. Their wedding will take place on February 26.

general news.headline: Live: Trump announces US's highest civilian honour to men's hockey Olympic heroTrump State of the Union Address Live Updates: US President Donald Trump is delivering his annual State of the Union (SOTU) address to Congress, his first speech in his second term. He is expected to focus on his administration's achievements and priorities. The address comes amid global uncertainty over Trump's tariffs, which were struck down by the US Supreme Court, and subsequently announcing a fresh round of 15% global levies. It also comes amid rising US-Iran tensions and fears of a possible strike on the Islamic Republic. The annual event was held as Trump faces low approval ratings and seeks to woo voters in the run-up to the November midterms. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Netanyahu launches Hexagon alliance against radicals, names India key partnerDays before PM Narendra Modi's Israel visit, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he plans to form a regional grouping, a Hexagon of alliances. Netanyahu said the bloc, which would include India, Greece and Cyprus, along with other unnamed Arab, African and Asian states, would take on radical Shia and Sunni adversaries.

Indian restaurant in London shuts after 16 years, owner blames Pakistani threatsAfter 16 years of dishing out authentic Indian flavours in London, Rangrez restaurant has shut its doors, citing mounting operational costs and growing safety concerns. Owner Harman Singh Kapoor said he faced repeated disturbances and inadequate police support, and will now turn his focus toward activism.

Rented Thar smashes car in Goa, Bhopal tourist dead, bid to save woman driverAccording to locals, the rental vehicle coming from the opposite direction was speeding, and a young woman was allegedly behind the wheel. Eyewitnesses claimed other women in the Thar tried to switch drivers to evade police action. The impact crushed the victim's car, triggering panic as locals rushed to help.

Kerala to become Keralam. But why West Bengal failed to become Bongo or Bangla?The Union Cabinet cleared the proposal to rename Kerala as Keralam. This paves the way for Parliament to take up the constitutional amendment. But West Bengal, which has pushed for a name change multiple times from the days of Jyoti Basu to Mamata Banerjee, has failed to secure the Centre's nod. So, why couldn't West Bengal get its name changed even after proposing it at least four times?

Rinku Singh leaves India camp, returns home due to family emergencyIndia batter Rinku Singh has left the national camp and returned home following a family emergency. India Today TV has learnt that his father, Khanchand Singh, is in a serious condition and has been admitted to a local hospital in Greater Noida.

Started in 2021, Anthropic now more valuable than Infosys, Wipro, TCS, HCL combinedAnthropic is an AI giant and a boogeyman as far as Indian IT industry is concerned. Yet, the surprising fact is that this is a 5-year-old company. In these five years it has gone from being a safety-focused AI startup to a $380 billion behemoth, now worth more than Indian tech giants TCS, Infosys, Wipro and HCLTech combined.

T20 World Cup: Can Pakistan still qualify for semi-final?Pakistan were beaten by England in the Super 8s of the T20 World Cup 2026. After their loss, Pakistan are on the brink of an exit from the tournament. But, can the Cornered Tigers still qualify?

How struggling actor posed as IIT Bombay student, lived in hostel for monthsA struggling actor stayed in one of IIT Bombay's hostels for four months without anyone getting a whiff that he wasn't a student. The account of the person, who spoke exclusively to India Today Digital, reveals gaps in the security at one of India's premier institutes, where five live bullets were recovered from a BTech student's bag last week. He was accommodating a visitor illegally in his room.

Sikh man kidnapped, found dead in California in mistaken identity attackAvtar Singh, a 57-year-old Sikh man of Indian origin, was abducted outside a California gurdwara and later found dead in a suspected case of mistaken identity. He is survived by his wife and infant triplets.

Sasikala announces launch of political party, reveals flag ft JayalalithaaSasikala, who was expelled from the AIADMK, revealed the flag of her party during an event on Tuesday. She, however, said that she would announce the name of her party soon.

India-Israel free trade talks kick off in Delhi ahead of PM Modi's visit to IsraelAhead of PM Modi's visit to Israel on Wednesday, India and Israel began the first round of negotiations for a proposed Free Trade Agreement in New Delhi.

From co-stars to life partners, their easy and unhurried bond is what has made audiences across India root for them.

Toilet war on US warship amid Iran tensions raises a stinkThe US may be planning a strike on Iran, but aboard its largest aircraft carrier, the USS Gerald R Ford, the crew are preoccupied with a more pressing issue -- finding a working toilet.

India's monsoon will worsen: Ocean's salt could be making El Nino strongerIn a strong El Nino year, India faces about a 60 per cent likelihood of drought conditions in at least some regions, accompanied by a weaker monsoon and higher temperatures.

Venezuela sends mega 2-million-barrel oil cargoes to India as exports surgeVenezuela has chartered its first supertankers since easing US sanctions, boosting crude exports to India as refiners seek discounted heavy oil and diversify away from Russian supplies.

Twin brothers marry twin sisters in rare double wedding in TelanganaThe visually striking ceremony, where both couples performed rituals side by side, left guests amazed as many struggled to tell the siblings apart, turning the celebration into a major local attraction.

Only Murders star Martin Short's daughter Katherine dies by suicide: ReportKatherine Short, the eldest child of Martin Short, has died at the age of 42. The Los Angeles Police Department responded to a call on Monday evening, where she was found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

India's perennial spin conundrum: Can't play spin, can't bowl spinIndia are facing a severe conundrum in the T20 World Cup. Neither have they been able to bat well against spin, nor are they bowling it well in the tournament.

Shots fired at car of lawyer linked to Lawrence Bishnoi in Delhi; 1 injuredInitial information suggests that around four bullets were fired in the incident. No casualties were reported in the attack. The police are examining footage from nearby CCTV cameras.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 28 | Karunanidhi's Coronation: Pen-Master, Pulse & The PlotWhen C.N. Annadurai (Anna) breathed his last in early 1969, the Dravidian canopy didn't just lose its shade; it lost its structural integrity. For over two decades, Anna had been the scholarly glue—the polished polymath—who held together the raw, rationalist energy of Erode and the rising, restless ambitions of his Thambis.

Drugged, raped, forced to convert: Sex racket run by Bhopal sisters bustedA sex racket run by two sisters in Bhopal, where vulnerable women were lured with the promise of jobs, and then drugged and raped, has been busted by the police. That's not all. One of the survivors claimed she was forced to convert and threatened when she resisted.

sports.headline: Amid PAK snub buzz, ECB tells Hundred teams to pick players on merit The England and Wales Cricket Board, along with all eight franchises of The Hundred, have declared that player selection will remain rooted in performance and availability, following concerns about the potential exclusion of Pakistan players during the upcoming auction.

India's perennial spin conundrum: Can't play spin, can't bowl spin India are facing a severe conundrum in the T20 World Cup. Neither have they been able to bat well against spin, nor are they bowling it well in the tournament.

How Brendon McCullum's masterplan downed Pakistan in Pallekele? Harry Brook reveals Harry Brook's century helped England chase down Pakistan's 165 in the T20 World Cup Super 8 fixture and qualify for the semi-final. Following their win, Brook revealed head coach Brendon McCullum's tactical masterstroke that helped them edge past Pakistan.

T20 World Cup: Can Pakistan still qualify for semi-final? Pakistan were beaten by England in the Super 8s of the T20 World Cup 2026. After their loss, Pakistan are on the brink of an exit from the tournament. But, can the Cornered Tigers still qualify?

Harry Brook's historic century sinks Pakistan, fires England into T20 World Cup semis T20 World Cup, ENG vs PAK: Harry Brook smashed 100 off 51 balls as England defeated Pakistan by two wickets in Pallekele to seal their place in the semifinals. With this loss, Pakistan now find themselves in a must-win situation heading into their final Super 8 clash against Sri Lanka.

After historic T20 WC, Italy Cricket hit with sexual assault allegations: Report Italy Cricket has suspended an unnamed official from their federation after allegations over inappropriately touching a member of Italy's women's national team.

Rinku Singh leaves India camp, returns home due to family emergency India batter Rinku Singh has left the national camp and returned home following a family emergency. India Today TV has learnt that his father, Khanchand Singh, is in a serious condition and has been admitted to a local hospital in Greater Noida.

Afghanistan name ex-Pakistan coach as head coach after Jonathan Trott departs Richard Pybus has replaced Jonathan Trott as head coach and will join the team ahead of the ODI and T20I series against Sri Lanka in March. Trott stepped down after Afghanistan's campaign in the Men's T20 World Cup.

Lucknow Super Giants reveal new elephant-inspired logo ahead of IPL 2026 Lucknow Super Giants unveiled their new logo ahead of this year's Indian Premier League season, saying it "carries the spirit of the city, Uttar Pradesh and the fans who have stood by the franchise since the start."

Mitchell Santner wary of Sri Lanka challenge as race for semi-finals intensifies T20 World Cup 2026, NZ vs SL: Speaking to the reporters, New Zealand skipper Mitchell Santner said that the Kiwis are wary of the threat that Sri Lanka may pose in their Super 8 clash on Wednesday in Colombo.

T20 World Cup semi-final, final tickets on sale. But where is the match? The T20 World Cup semi-final and finals tickets have gone live on sale. Tickets are available for Kolkata, Mumbai, Ahmedabad and Colombo, without even knowing at which exact venue the matches will be played?

Influencer receives rape threats, deletes viral T20 World Cup reel with David MillerInfluencer Princy Parikh deleted her viral reel with David Miller after receiving rape threats and body-shaming abuse online during the ongoing T20 World Cup.

ENG vs PAK, Super 8 Highlights: Harry Brook's century guides England into semi finalEngland (ENG) vs Pakistan (PAK), T20 World Cup Super 8 Highlights: England qualified for the semi-final, following a 2-wicket victory in Pallekele. Captain Harry Brook led from the front with his 51-ball hundred while Shaheen Afridi's remarkable spell of 4/30 went in vain.

Pandya, Dube not Malcolm Marshall, India missing Kuldeep: Shoaib AkhtarFormer Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has criticised India's bowling strategy after their heavy defeat to South Africa in the T20 World Cup. He highlighted the need to include Kuldeep Yadav to strengthen India's bowling attack in upcoming matches.

New Zealand will keep a close eye on Pakistan vs England clash: Mitchell SantnerT20 World Cup, NZ vs SL: Skipper Mitchell Santner said New Zealand will keep a close eye on the Pakistan‑England clash on Tuesday in Pallekele as the race for semifinal spots intensifies.

Not pushovers in Ranji Trophy final: J&K dominate Day 1 against KarnatakaShubham Pundir led from the front with a commanding unbeaten 117 as Jammu & Kashmir dominated the proceedings on the opening day of the Ranji Trophy final in Hubballi against Karnataka.

From 300 alert to do or die: Star Sports eats a humble pie in T20 World CupT20 World Cup: Star Sports has been forced to eat humble pie at the ICC T20 World Cup 2026. After a bullish advertising campaign, the broadcaster has had to dial down its tone following India's loss to South Africa in Ahmedabad.

India Women falter in world champion era, suffer 6-wicket defeat to AustraliaINDW vs AUSW, 1st ODI: Harmanpreet Kaur's India slumped to a six-wicket defeat to Alyssa Healy's Australia on Tuesday at the Allan Border Field in Brisbane. Beth Mooney, who completed 3000 ODI runs, won the Player of the Match award.

Squash: CCI Brabourne Stadium to host the Indian Open 2026 from March 18 to 22The historic CCI Brabourne Stadium will host the second edition of the Indian Open, a PSA Copper event, from March 18 to 22, 2026, with tickets for the tournament now live.

India suffer injury blow as Harmanpreet Kaur does not come out to field in BrisbaneIND-W vs AUS-W, 1st ODI: Harmanpreet Kaur suffered a left knee injury during the first ODI in Brisbane and did not field in the second innings, with Smriti Mandhana stepping in to lead India against Australia.

India vs Pakistan clash confirmed as ICC unveils Women's T20 World Cup scheduleBangladesh will be slotted alongside India and Pakistan in an explosive Group 1 after the International Cricket Council on Tuesday announced the complete list of fixtures for the upcoming Women's T20 World Cup 2026.

Gautam Gambhir's politics has damaged Indian team's image: Ex-PAK batterT20 World Cup: Former Pakistan batter Ahmed Shehzad has slammed India coach Gautam Gambhir and claimed that he has brought politics into the Indian team environment. Gambhir is facing mounting pressure after India's loss to South Africa.

Steve Bucknor regrets giving Sachin Tendulkar out lbw in 2004 Gabba TestLegendary West Indies umpire Steve Bucknor has admitted that giving Sachin Tendulkar out LBW in the 2003-04 Gabba Test was a mistake. Bucknor, now 79, was one of the most respected match officials of his time, having officiated in over 120 Tests and served on the umpiring panel at multiple World Cups.

Focus only on playing good cricket: Hope backs West Indies before SA, IND tiesT20 World Cup: After their thrilling win against Zimbabwe, Shai Hope has backed the West Indies in the upcoming matches against South Africa and India in the T20 World Cup. Hope also refused to reveal the spin plans against India and how the focus is on getting wins for the team and not records.

Play like Virat Kohli: Tilak Varma gets advice from EX-IND batter amid poor formFormer India cricketer Mohammed Kaif has urged Tilak Varma to shut out the noise and stick to his original gameplan of being an anchor in the T20I side. Tilak has struggled for runs during the tournament.

Super Sub Sesko ready to deliver for Manchester United whenever Carrick callsBenjamin Sesko insists he is unfazed by his role under Michael Carrick and is ready to make an impact for Manchester United whenever called upon.

Zimbabwe needs to focus on getting small wins ahead of India clash: Justin SammonsT20 World Cup: Zimbabwe's head coach Justin Sammons talked about how the side needs to focus on winning those small battles rather than getting overwhelmed by the bigger picture. They now face India in the Super 8s, where it is a do-or-die clash for both teams.

T20 World Cup: Zimbabwe aim to learn from West Indies loss to counter ruthless IndiaT20 World Cup: Zimbabwe hope to apply lessons from their heavy loss to West Indies as they prepare for a must-win Super 8 clash against defending champions India in Chennai on February 26.

Will West Indies target India's spin weakness? Hope keeps everyone guessingT20 World Cup: West Indies captain Shai Hope remained coy about his spin plans against India when both teams battle it out in the Super 8 stage of the T20 World Cup 2026. West Indies spinners have been on top of their game during the ICC event.

PAK vs ENG: Will rain washout yet another Super 8s game for Pakistan in Pallekele?PAK vs ENG, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: Pakistan's second Super 8s game against England in Pallekele looks set to avoid the rain that washed out their opener, with forecasts showing just a 2 per cent chance of showers on Tuesday.

Spin troubles aside, India should stay patient with Abhishek SharmaT20 World Cup: Abhishek Sharma's continuous poor form in T20 World Cup 2026 has intensified calls for change, with Sanju Samson emerging as a possible alternative. With India in a do-or-die situation, their next selection move could determine the fate of their World Cup campaign.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
